Material used.Material Source: Recombinant protein expressed in E. coli
Material used.Material Name: Untagged wild - type, A104T, M26I and E163K DJ - 1
Material used.Description: DSC experiments were performed using untagged wild - type, A104T, M26I and E163K DJ - 1 at 10 - 20 μM concentration in a VP - DSC microcalorimeter. Reduced DJ - 1 was dialyzed against vacuum degassed DSC buffer supplemented with 1mM β - mercaptoethanol at 4°C.

Readout description.Result Description: The wild - type protein has a Tm of 66.2°C, which is reduced by each PD mutation to varying extents; M26I (63.4°C), A104T (58.7°C) and E163K (55.1°C)

Technical replicates.Description: T m values differ by 1°C or less in replicate DSC experiments on a representative DJ - 1 sample.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data were processed by reference thermogram subtraction, concentration normalization, and progress baseline subtraction in the ORIGIN software package for DSC analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Tm of wild - type DJ - 1 is 66.2°C

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Tm lower than that of wild - type DJ - 1

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant protein expressed in E. coli
Material used.Material Name: Tag - cleaved A104T, E163K and M26I DJ - 1
Material used.Description: Tag - cleaved protein samples were thawed on ice and buffer exchanged by rapid dialysis for 2 to 3 hours at 4°C against 25 mM HEPES, pH = 7.5, 100 mM KCl and 1 mM DTT. After dialysis, the samples and buffer were centrifuged to remove particulates and diluted to the required concentration (1.0, 1.5 or 2.0 mg/ml) in the dialysis buffer.

Readout description.Result Description: Sedimentation equilibrium ultracentrifugation indicates that A104T, E163K and M26I DJ - 1 all exist as dimers in solution

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: A variety of self - association models were fit to the data and the quality of fit was judged by both the magnitude and absence of systematic trends in the fit residuals. A model containing a single dimeric species for each sample fit the data adequately, and more complex models that included monomer - dimer or dimer - tetramer self - association did not improve the fit. The general equation used to fit the dimeric model to the data was used.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of monomeric or higher order oligomeric states

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant protein expressed in E. coli
Material used.Material Name: Tag - cleaved A104T, E163K and M26I DJ - 1
Material used.Description: Tag cleaved DJ - 1 proteins were diluted to 10 μM in 10 mM potassium phosphate buffer, pH = 7.5

Readout description.Molecular Effect: No significant alteration of secondary structure
Readout description.Result Description: The secondary structural content of DJ - 1 in solution is approximately 35% α - helix, 18% β - strand and 47% coil/turn/other, and is not significantly altered by the A104T, E163K and M26I mutations

Technical replicates.Description: Spectra were measured in continuous scanning mode at 50 nm min - 1 with a 2 nm bandwidth and an accumulation of five scans per spectrum.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Secondary structural content similar to wild - type DJ - 1

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from the secondary structural content of wild - type DJ - 1

Material used.Material Source: Recombinant protein expressed in E. coli
Material used.Description: Crystals of E163K DJ - 1 - 6xHis in space group P3121 were grown at room temperature in 2 - 7 days using sodium citrate as a precipitant. Crystals of other mutants were grown using the hanging drop vapor diffusion method by mixing protein with reservoir solution and equilibrating against the reservoir solution for 2 - 10 days at room temperature.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Structural changes such as disorder, disruption of salt bridge, packing defects
Readout description.Result Description: A104T: introduction of water and a discretely disordered residue into the core; E163K: disruption of a key salt bridge with R145; M26I: packing defects in the core of the dimer

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: For A104T, E163K, and M26I DJ - 1, refinement was performed against an intensity - based, weighted least squares residual target function. For A104V, M26L, and E163K/R145E DJ - 1, conjugate gradient minimization refinement against a maximum likelihood, amplitude - based target function was used.
